column5: Sunday marked the beginning of the 2013 boating season for me.  A three hour 5am drive from Ottawa to Lake O to hit the Browns was the order of the day. We trolled for about 6hrs before the 3 hr drive back to Ottawa.  One heck of a day trip but we did manage this beauty.    My good buddy JM with his first ever Brown Trout. Congrats bud, that'll be tough to top for a while.

Nice lake O brown for sure !!!!! I used to have a blast getting them in the spring at the nuke plant outflow !!!!! Miss them days ..... Thanks for sharing  we used to flatline j-9 and j-11 rapalas and sometimes the offshore yellow boards on the shoreline side and get them as shallow as 10-15 fow !!!!!! Cheers
Was it worth the drive? I think so, the bonus was you snagged a beauty to boot.
Nice job Matt!  Going to scratch my Lake O itch this weekend, heading down to Port Weller for a few days.
Way to go Matt - L.J. Told me all about the trip.  Always good to travel and not get skunked.  David  aka  Superdad
Congrats - looking forward to some of those, and maybe a few other LO  swimmers this weekend. Hopin' to show the skunk the door for '13, finally.
That's a beauty lake O brownie, congrats to your buddy.  Go Sens Go!!!
oh, you actually fish, I thought you just talk smack  nice, fat brown JM
lol, yes, I fish!! lolol  Talking smack is just for fun, fishing is the serious stuff.
